marketNews.title: Gaikindo Notes Car Wholesale Sales Reached ~74 Thousand Units in October 2025
marketNews.content: Gaikindo noted national car wholesale sales in October 2025 reached approximately 74 thousand units (-4% YoY, +19% MoM). This result marks the return of monthly car wholesales to a level above 70 thousand, after April-September 2025 only recorded an average monthly sales of approximately 59 thousand units. This realization brings national car wholesale sales for 10M25 to approximately 636 thousand units (-11% YoY), equivalent to 71-85% of Gaikindo's 2025 target (vs. 10M24: 82% realization for 2024).

marketNews.title: National Car Sales in October 2025 were Boosted by BYD's Sales Surge
marketNews.content: Based on a CNBC Indonesia report, national car sales in October 2025 were also driven by a surge in BYD sales, which recorded a sales volume of approximately 11 thousand units - almost 4 times higher compared to its monthly average sales since January 2025 at approximately 3 thousand units - which we estimate came from the delivery backlog for the Atto 1.

marketNews.title: Gaikindo Optimistic on Sales Acceleration in Nov-Dec 2025 Despite Weak Purchasing Power Concerns
marketNews.content: Gaikindo Secretary General, Kukuh Kumara, said that the association is optimistic that car sales can accelerate further in the November-December 2025 period, so there are no plans to revise this year's sales target. One source of this optimism comes from the organization of the Gaikindo Jakarta Auto Week automotive exhibition on November 21-30, 2025. However, Gaikindo Chairman I, Jongkie Sugiarto, assessed that public purchasing power remains weak even though economic growth has started to improve.

marketNews.title: AISI Records Domestic Motorcycle Sales Reached ~590 Thousand Units in October 2025
marketNews.content: In a separate report, the Indonesian Motorcycle Industry Association (AISI) noted that domestic motorcycle sales in October 2025 reached approximately 590 thousand units (+8% YoY, +4% MoM), marking the highest monthly sales since August 2024 and simultaneously recording year-on-year growth above 5% consecutively since September 2025. This result brings domestic motorcycle sales for 10M25 to approximately 5.4 million units (+0.2% YoY), marking the first cumulative annual growth since the beginning of the year. The realization of domestic motorcycle sales for 10M25 is equivalent to 81-85% of AISI's 2025 target in the range of 6.4-6.7 million units (vs. 10M24: ~86% realization for 2024).

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway: Automotive Sales Trend Shows Recovery Despite Normalized BYD Sales
marketNews.content: Although the national car sales figure in October 2025 was boosted by the surge in BYD volume, we assess that the overall automotive sales trend is starting to show recovery. For context, setting aside the BYD sales surge due to backlog, we estimate that normalized car wholesale in October 2025 was around 66 thousand units, about +12% higher than the monthly average sales in the April-September 2025 period. Meanwhile, two-wheeler sales growth year-on-year is already in positive territory as of 10M25. We see this automotive sales recovery aligning with signs of economic improvement that we highlighted in previous Snips. Discussions regarding Indonesia's economic growth in 3Q25 can be read here.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway: Government Discusses Potential Merger Between Grab and GOTO, Involving Danantara
marketNews.content: Key Takeaway: Government Discusses Potential Merger Between Grab and GOTO, Involving Danantara

marketNews.title: US Senate Agrees on Compromise Budget Plan to End Government Shutdown
marketNews.content: The US Senate on Sunday (9/11) local time agreed on a compromise budget plan to end the government shutdown. The package also includes a bill to fund certain parts of the government until the end of the fiscal year. Although agreed upon in the US Senate, the budget law that will reopen the US federal government still requires agreement in the US House of Representatives and approval from President Donald Trump. The US government shutdown has been ongoing since October 1, 2025, marking the longest federal government closure in history.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia Notes Indonesian Consumer Confidence Index Surged to 121.2 in October 2025
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia noted that the Indonesian consumer confidence index surged to 121.2 in October 2025 (vs. September 2025: 115, October 2024: 121.1). This result was driven by increases across all sub-indices, with the employment availability index recording the highest monthly increase of 10.6 points to 102.6.

marketNews.title: Ministry of Finance is Reviewing Plans to Add Diapers, Wet Wipes, and Single-Use Cutlery Under Excise Tax
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Finance is currently reviewing plans to add diapers, wet wipes, and single-use eating and drinking utensils as new excise goods, based on the statement in Ministry of Finance Regulation No. 70/2025 regarding the strategic plan for customs and excise sectors. This plan is part of efforts to expand state revenue sources. The Ministry of Finance is also preparing steps to expand the revenue base from export duties, including proposals to increase the upper limit for palm oil exports. In the mid-term policy period of 2025-2029, the government also includes excise tax on motorized vehicle emissions and high-sodium processed food products (P2OB) in the recommendations for state revenue management programs.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia Will Consider the Right Time for Rupiah Redenomination
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia stated on Monday (10/11) that they will consider the right time to implement the rupiah redenomination, taking into account economic, political, social stability, and technical readiness. Bank Indonesia also mentioned it will focus on maintaining rupiah stability during the redenomination process. This plan is currently being discussed by Bank Indonesia, the government, and the DPR. The Rupiah Redenomination Bill has been included in the mid-term national legislation program for the 2025-2029 period as a government initiative Bill proposed by Bank Indonesia.

marketNews.title: Malaysian Palm Oil Board Notes Palm Oil Stock Rose +4.4% MoM in October 2025, Highest Since April 2019
marketNews.content: Malaysian Palm Oil Board noted that Malaysian palm oil stocks rose +4.4% MoM to 2.46 million tons in October 2025, marking the eighth consecutive monthly increase and the highest level since April 2019. This was driven by a production surge of +11% MoM to 2.04 million tons - which marks the highest production level since August 2015 - while exports grew +19% MoM to 1.69 million tons.

marketNews.title: China's National Bureau of Statistics Notes CPI Inflation Reached 0.2% YoY in October 2025
marketNews.content: China's national statistics bureau noted that China's consumer price index (CPI) inflation reached 0.2% YoY in October 2025 (vs. September 2025: 0.3% YoY deflation), exceeding consensus expectations which predicted flat movement. This result marks the first annual CPI inflation since June 2025 and the fastest pace since January 2025. On a monthly basis, CPI inflation reached 0.2% MoM (vs. September 2025: 0.1% MoM inflation), marking the highest level in the last 3 months. Meanwhile, core inflation reached 1.2% YoY (vs. September 2025: 1% YoY inflation), marking the highest level in the last 20 months.

tickerNews.title: Government Discussing Merger Opportunity for Grab and GOTO, Involving Danantara
tickerNews.content: State Secretary Minister, Prasetyo Hadi, said on Friday (7/11) that the government is discussing the potential merger of Grab and GoTo Gojek Tokopedia. Prasetyo mentioned that the merger scheme for the two ride-hailing companies will be included in the discussion of the draft presidential regulation concerning the status, protection, and tariffs for online motorcycle taxi drivers or partners. Prasetyo also added that there is a potential for Danantara's involvement in the Grab and GOTO merger process. Prasetyo stated that the concrete form of the Grab-GOTO merger, whether in a merger or acquisition scheme, is still under discussion. The combined Grab-GOTO entity will have a market share of more than 91% in Indonesia, according to data analysis company Euromonitor International. Previously, Bloomberg in June 2025 reported that Danantara was beginning talks with GOTO to acquire a minority stake in the combined entity of Grab and GOTO, but Reuters in the same month reported that the plan for the Grab and GOTO merger faced regulatory obstacles.

tickerNews.title: GOTO Merger Speculation Could be an Exit Strategy for TLKM's Investment
tickerNews.content: Kontan reported that the discourse on the merger of Grab and GoTo Gojek Tokopedia ($GOTO) will be one of the exit strategies to divest Telkom Indonesia's investment in GOTO. Kontan sources stated that GOTO's initial shareholders will execute a buyout of TLKM's GOTO ownership through a special purpose vehicle in Singapore, with a value not far from TLKM's investment value in GOTO in 2020 of 300 million US dollars or approximately 4.98 trillion rupiah. Kontan mentioned that GOTO CEO Patrick Walujo, Erick Thohir, and Garibaldi Thohir are reportedly pooling funds to execute this buyout plan, but the three have not commented on this issue.

tickerNews.title: AADI to Distribute 2025 Interim Dividend of $250 Million
tickerNews.content: Adaro Andalan Indonesia will distribute an interim dividend for the 2025 fiscal year amounting to 250 million US dollars or approximately 536 rupiah per share assuming an exchange rate of 16,686 rupiah per US dollar. This amount indicates a dividend yield of approximately 6.1% as of Monday (10/11). The cum dividend date in the regular and negotiation market is November 17, 2025, while the payment date is November 27, 2025.

tickerNews.title: GIAA Revises Private Placement Plan, Potential Proceeds Reduced to ~IDR 23.7 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Garuda Indonesia announced a revision to the execution plan for its private placement, with the potential proceeds decreasing to approximately 23.7 trillion rupiah, down from the previous ~1.85 billion US dollars or 30.8 trillion rupiah assuming an exchange rate of 16,686 rupiah per US dollar. Based on the new information disclosure, the cash capital injection from PT Danantara Asset Management decreased to 17 trillion rupiah, from previously sebesar ~1.4 billion US dollars or ~24 trillion rupiah. Meanwhile, the plan for shareholder loan conversion remains unchanged at 405 million US dollars or approximately 6.8 trillion rupiah. The new disclosure also eliminated fleet expansion from the use of funds purpose, but still maintained planned uses of funds for the company's working capital and operations, Citilink's working capital and operations, and repayment of Citilink's fuel purchase debt. With this change in the private placement value, the dilution of public share ownership also changed from a previous decrease to 5.03% to a level of 6.17%. Before this corporate action plan was carried out, the proportion of public shareholders in GIAA reached 27.47%. This plan will be discussed in the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (EGMS) on November 12, 2025.

tickerNews.title: CBRE Plans Rights Issue by Converting Debt to Shares, Involving SKRN
tickerNews.content: Cakra Buana Resources Energi plans to hold a rights issue of up to 48 billion new shares by converting debt under a promissory note agreement into shares to Hilong Shipping Holding Limited, Yafin Tandiono Tan, PT Saga Investama Sedaya, and Superkrane Mitra Utama ($SKRN). Previously, CBRE signed a promissory note agreement totaling 55 million US dollars with these parties to finance part of the acquisition of 1 pipe-laying and lifting vessel unit worth 100 million US dollars from Hilong Shipping Holding Limited. This plan will be discussed in the EGMS on December 18, 2025.

tickerNews.title: BBTN Has Disbursed ~IDR 23.3 Trillion of Government Liquidity Injection as of October 31, 2025
tickerNews.content: Bank Tabungan Negara President Director, Nixon Napitupulu, stated that his party has channeled government liquidity injections amounting to approximately 23.3 trillion rupiah up to October 31, 2025, equivalent to approximately 93% of the total government placement fund of 25 trillion rupiah. Previously, BBTN estimated that the entire liquidity injection fund from the government would be absorbed before mid-November 2025. Based on segmentation, the credit disbursement from this liquidity injection is focused on the housing sector, for both developers and for Housing Loan financing.
